meta.title: جاوااسکریپت: از راه درستش
meta.description: یک مرجع سریع به بهترین شیوه برای برنامه‌نویسی جاوااسکریپت -- پیوند به الگوها و آموزش‌های سراسر وب

links.title: ارائه دهنده‌های PaaS (بستر به عنوان سرویس)

links.name: Mocha
links.description: Maintained by TJ Holowaychuk

links.name: QUnit
links.description: Maintained by jQuery

links.name: Jasmine
links.description: Maintained by Pivotal Labs

links.name: Karma
links.description: Maintained by the team behind AngularJS. Mostly by Vojta Jina

links.name: Intern
links.description: Maintained by Sitepen

links.name: Istanbul
links.description: A JavaScript code coverage tool written in JavaScript, maintained by Krishnan Anantheswaran

links.name: Sinon.JS
links.description: Standalone test spies, stubs and mocks for JavaScript. No dependencies, works with any unit testing framework. Created by Sinon.JS community

links.name: DexterJS
links.description: A test helper to mock functions and the XHR object, maintained by Leo Balter

links.name: AVA
links.description: Test runner with asynchronous tests, maintained by Sindre Sorhus

links.name: jQuery
links.description: jQuery is a fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library. Built by John Resig.

links.name: YUI
links.description: Built by Yahoo!, YUI is a free, open source JavaScript and CSS library for building richly interactive web applications. New development has stopped since August 29th, 2014.

links.name: ZeptoJS
links.description: Zepto is a minimalist JavaScript library for modern browsers with a largely jQuery-compatible API. If you use jQuery, you already know how to use Zepto.

links.name: Dojo Toolkit
links.description: Dojo is a free, open-source JavaScript toolkit for building high performance web applications. Project sponsors include IBM and SitePen.

links.name: Underscore.js
links.description: Underscore.js is a JavaScript library that provides a whole mess of useful functional programming helpers without extending any built-in objects.

links.name: Backbone.js
links.description: Very popular JavaScript client-side framework, built by @jashkenas.

links.name: Ember.js
links.description: Built by @wycats, jQuery and Ruby on Rails core developer.

links.name: Knockout.js
links.description: Simplify dynamic JavaScript UIs by applying the Model-View-View Model (MVVM).

links.name: Angular.js
links.description: Built by Google, Angular.js is like a polyfill for the future of HTML.

links.name: Angular
links.description: One framework.Mobile & desktop. One way to build applications with Angular and reuse your code and abilities to build apps for any deployment target. For web, mobile web, native mobile and native desktop.

links.name: Cappuccino
links.description: Cappuccino is an open-source framework that makes it easy to build desktop-caliber applications that run in a web browser.

links.name: JavaScript MVC
links.description: JavaScriptMVC is an open-source framework containing the best ideas in jQuery development.

links.name: Meteor
links.description: Meteor is an open-source platform for building top-quality web apps in a fraction of the time, whether you're an expert developer or just getting started.

links.name: Spice.js
links.description: Spice is a super minimal (< 3k) and flexible MVC framework for javascript. Spice was built to be easily added to any existent application and play well with other technologies such as jQuery, pjax, turbolinks, node or whatever else you are using.

links.name: Riot.js
links.description: Riot is an incredibly fast, powerful yet tiny client side (MV*) library for building large scale web applications. Despite the small size all the building blocks are there: a template engine, router, event library and a strict MVP pattern to keep things organized.

links.name: CanJS
links.description: CanJS is a JavaScript framework that makes developing complex applications simple and fast. Easy-to-learn, small, and unassuming of your application structure, but with modern features like custom tags and 2-way binding.

links.name: React
links.description: Built by Facebook. React is a JavaScript library for creating user interfaces by Facebook and Instagram. Many people choose to think of React as the V in MVC.

links.name: Handlebars
links.description: Handlebars provides the power necessary to let you build semantic templates effectively with no frustration.

links.name: Dust.js
links.description: Asynchronous templates for the browser and node.js.

links.name: Velocity.js
links.description: Velocity is an animation engine with the same API as jQuery's $.animate().

links.name: Bounce.js
links.description: Bounce.js is a tool and JS library that lets you create beautiful CSS3 powered animations.

links.name: TweenJS
links.description: A simple but powerful JavaScript library for tweening and animating HTML5 and JavaScript properties.

links.name: Move.js
links.description: Move.js is a small JavaScript library making CSS3 backed animation extremely simple and elegant.

links.name: Snap.svg
links.description: SVG is an excellent way to create interactive, resolution-independent vector graphics that will look great on any size screen.

links.name: Rekapi
links.description: Rekapi is a library for making canvas and DOM animations with JavaScript, as well as CSS @keyframe animations for modern browsers.

links.name: Favico.js
links.description: Make use of your favicon with badges, images or videos.

links.name: Textillate.js
links.description: Textillate.js combines some awesome libraries to provide a ease-to-use plugin for applying CSS3 animations to any text.

links.name: Motio
links.description: Motio is a small JavaScript library for simple but powerful sprite based animations and panning.

links.name: MelonJS
links.description: MelonJS is a free, light-weight HTML5 game engine. The engine integrates the tiled map format making level design easier.

links.name: ImpactJS
links.description: ImpactJS is one of the more tested-and-true HTML5 game engines with the initial release all the way back at the end of 2010. It is very well maintained and updated, and has a good-sized community backing it. There exists plenty of documentation - even two books on the subject of creating games with the engine.

links.name: LimeJS
links.description: LimeJS is a HTML5 game framework for building fast, native-experience games for all modern touchscreens and desktop browsers.

links.name: Crafty
links.description: Crafty is a game engine that dates back to late 2010. Crafty makes it really easy to get started making JavaScript games.

links.name: Cocos2d-HTML5
links.description: Cocos2d-html5 is an open-source web 2D game framework, released under MIT License. It is a HTML5 version of Cocos2d-x project. The focus for Cocos2d-html5 development is around making Cocos2d cross platforms between browsers and native application.

links.name: Phaser
links.description: Phaser is based heavily on Flixel. It is maintained by Richard Davey (Photon Storm) who has been very active in the HTML5 community for years.

links.name: Goo
links.description: Goo is a 3D JavaScript gaming engine entirely built on WebGL/HTML5

links.name: LycheeJS
links.description: LycheeJS is a JavaScript Game library that offers a complete solution for prototyping and deployment of HTML5 Canvas, WebGL or native OpenGL(ES) based games inside the Web Browser or native environments.

links.name: Quintus
links.description: Quintus is an HTML5 game engine designed to be modular and lightweight, with a concise JavaScript-friendly syntax.

links.name: KiwiJS
links.description: Kiwi.js is a fun and friendly Open Source HTML5 Game Engine. Some people call it the WordPress of HTML5 game engines

links.name: PandaJS
links.description: Panda.js is a HTML5 game engine for mobile and desktop with Canvas and WebGL rendering.

links.name: Rot.js
links.description: Rot.js is a set of JavaScript libraries, designed to help with a roguelike development in browser environment.
